numbered_ace_sentences: 1. In all categories, young women are more likely than young men to reach out.
2. Young people are most likely to reach out to a parent by sending texts.
3. Young people are least likely to visit a parent in person.
4. There are noticeable gaps between the percentages of young women and young men.
5. Less than 50% of young men send texts to a parent.
6. Almost 75% of young women send texts to a parent.
7. About 30% of young men reach out by phone or video-chat.
8. More than 50% of young women reach out by phone or video-chat.
9. Visiting in person has the smallest difference between young women and young men.
10. The difference for visiting in person is about 5%.
11. The percentages for visiting in person are 25% or less.
12. Young women are more likely than young men to reach out.
13. It is not clear why young women are more likely than young men to reach out.
14. These people have relationships with their parents.
15. It is not clear how these people describe their relationships with their parents.
16. Family is a big part of many people's lives.
17. Some people cannot see all family members in person.
18. People live in a modern digital world.
19. There are alternatives to reach out.
20. It is not always convenient to visit in person.
21. People can make phone calls.
22. People can send texts.
23. The headline is: Going Digital: Keeping in Touch with Loved Ones.
